alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Escambia Inland; Okaloosa Coastal; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued August 13 at 1:16PM EDT until August 13 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IS NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...For today`s Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 115. For Monday`s Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to around 115 expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Alabama, northwest Florida and southeast Mississippi. * WHEN...For today`s Excessive Heat Warning, until 7 PM CDT this evening. For Monday`s Excessive Heat Warning, from 10 AM to 7 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
